body.p:
Falmouth Ky -- April 13th 1863.
Hon. James F. Robinson
Dear sir,

Enclosed I send you a petition in favor of G. T. Gallion & his bail. The facts are stated in the petition, The subscribers are from the immediate vicinity of Gallion's residence, and are well acquainted with the facts stated in the petition, and they are all loyal citizens, I think the case is a fit one for executive clemency, Gallion entered the Union Army at Camp Dick Robinson before the bond was forfeited, and is still absent in the Army,

Our Court commences next Monday, and and if your Excedllency remits the bond I ought to have it by Monday Morning as the case will come up on the first day, If the remission takes place before judgment the whole bond can be remitted, as decided by the Court of Appeals.
